dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is a witness for a UN investigation! GDA EMPLOYEES peer. An INTERN betrays a twinge of complic LAURA LEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We handed her over to the police a few hours ago. I couldn't keep her. I've already done every favour I could for you. This is not on me. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no right to do that! LAURA LEVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had every right. We have a system that works here. You're the one disrupting it. Kathy stares at her. Fuming. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did they take her? Laura shrugs. Shaking off guilt has become a necessary ha Just then the door opens. And...

dialogues.speaker: HALYNA
dialogues.text: Walks in. Disoriented, emotion rising...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... look for Laura Levin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. Kathy holds her anger, smiling respectfully at Halyna. La leads her away. Kathy searches for an answer, her eyes landing on... The Intern. Unrelenting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know anything, this is on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the cops leave them somewhere near the border, so that with no papers, the girls have to cross the border illegally. Take the 103 to Visegrad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy. Speeding down the 103. A two-lane winding road. Seeing... Nothing but the 20 feet her headlights show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko steers the Van around a corner. Raya sits in the bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura hands an excited Halyna a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back in about an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy's eyes GLUED on the road, trying to make out a SIGN LANDMINES. Then another sign... VISEGRAD PRAVO. Sharp Turn. Onto a GRAVEL ROAD. She brakes. SKIDDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko stops at a traffic light. Raya peers out a crack in van. Seeing... Young WOMEN in the streets. Laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy slows her car... FLICKERING LIGHTS. She approaches. A BORDER STATION: A GRAVEL ROAD leads up to it. Kathy slo BORDER GUARDS smoke and play cards. One guard saunters ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a girl. She was dropped here a few hours ago. He shrugs, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you check the border logs? She's about 15, the police brought her here but she didn't have a passport. Maybe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady. I know what you're looking for. Those girls do not go through the border. They go through there... He points... A THICK Forest. Stretching for MILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Serbia. Kathy stares at the endless forest. A dirt road cuts thro the middle. She jumps in her SUV, and HURTLES down the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko turns down a narrow street. He glances in his rear v mirror. An old TRABBANT follows him. He veers down an all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy's SUV crawls alongside the FOREST. HIGHBEAMS off th top of the car. SCANNING all around. Then, in a clearing ahead... A SILHOUETTE. Kathy ACCELERATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko eyes the mirror. All clear. Turning onto a DESERTED STREET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy HURTLES closer to the silhouette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. It's Irka. Kathy cranks the wheel, driving off road and onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV is jolted by the uneven terrain. Irka peers into blinding light. Then runs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko drives up the deserted street. SUDDENLY two BATTERED MERCEDES fly out from SIDE ROADS and block the way. Viko BRAKES hard. Raya is thrown to the side of the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stops the car, jumps out, and runs after Irka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irka! Irka's legs start to give. Kathy gains on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko REVERSES and TURNS -- but a Mercedes ROARS -- 'round other side -- BASHING the side of the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy feels Irka slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MEN jump out of the cars. With RIFLES. Viko SPEEDS forward. But.. GUNFIRE. Raya SCREAMS. A TIRE BLOWN OUT. The Van SKIDS to a HALT. Viko SMASHES against the window. Raya tries the doors, but they won't open. She wails, SLAMMING herself against the door. Desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy raises her arms, waving... Irka turns. Kathy can see her clearly now, disoriented be bearing. Irka shields her face from the distant headlight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy steps out of their glare. And then...Irka recognize her. She collapses, releasing confused tears. Kathy walks over, careful, slowly bending to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... let me die. Kathy holds her. As the young girl cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men approach the Van. Raya's BANGING ECHOES from insi reverberating around the empty street. Nobody can hear he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolated stars peek through clouds, drifting over dark hi stretching far into the horizon....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Viko sit silent. Barry hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We've got a safe house in the mountains. Nobody knows she's here, so we're clear to take her there now. Kathy looks across the room to Irka, who sits hunched, looking out the window. Totally alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE AGED COUPLE lead Irka inside a small home. In th MIDDLE OF NOWHERE. Shrouded in the black night. Nobody wi find her here. In the doorway, Irka turns to Kathy and Vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Raya? They stare back at her. The woman closes the door. Kathy Viko stand in the dead silence. His face bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back to the Florida Bar--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he'd be that stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care! I have nothing else to go on, do I? Adrenalin overtaking sadness. Viko follows Kathy to the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Viko pull up. It's in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step inside, and IN ONE GLANCE, see... THE WHOLE SET GIRLS is different. No Luba, No Raya, No Tanjo... The IPT barely notice her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy steps out. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They moved them already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! At the end of her rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, at a total loss, eyes... Halyna. Sitting. Terrifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How could? No, no, no... my, Raya.... What!? What will they do to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BROWN VAN snakes through the distant mountain roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IVAN, 40s, drives. Tanjo is in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stop soon. We're far enough now. Ivan nods. Tanjo cranes into the back of the van. He turn an overhead light, revealing... Five girls. Huddled in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to testify? All the girls turn to... Raya. Their conscience paralyzed the need to survive. Terrified, Raya looks to... Luba. He eyes pleading for support. But Luba turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. We all move to a new bar now. Somewhere no one will come look for you. Then we have a conversation. The girls avoid Raya's gaze. She sobs. Tanjo turns off th light. The van drives off into the unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands by her SUV, watching MONITORS set off for th day. Then she sees... Fred Murray emerge with COLLEAGUES, laughing. He stops wh He sees Kathy, gazing over, serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Fred walk between the parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fifteen. I'm begging you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know any of the other bars he owns, anything... I'm appealing to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm gonna say this one more time. And you can put this down in your investigation on me. I don't know what you're talking about. He leaves. Kathy stands, a black speck in the patchwork o white UN SUVs spread across the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's SECRETARY shakes her head at Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've called and paged. He says he can't get into this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know that one of my witnesses was abducted? Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Kathy, he really didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Kathy is downcast. She nods, not totally convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irka won't testify now. It's completely understandable. She's way too scared. I just... I don't know what to do with her. The GDA won't take her and her traffickers will find her if she's in this city. Emotion taking over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These girls are dragged into this country like cattle and then the system that's supposed to help them spits them right back out. It barely recognizes sex trafficking as a problem even though it's a fucking epidemic, and everyone knows it. Are we supposed to wait around for that to change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time for a little diplomacy... Do you have a nice frock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands in front of a mirror, in a black dress, her hanging down to her shoulders. She stands, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You think it's okay? She turns to Jan and Carmen, sitting on her bed. Jan smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful. But Carmen is tilting her head, doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop standing like a farmer's wife for starters. These people are dignitaries. You gotta up your game. She approaches her, and sweeps her hair up into an elegan chignon. She takes off her own earrings and puts them on Kathy. Jan nods, impressed. Kathy eyes herself, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHITE VOLKSWAGON RABBIT speeds though the Sarajevo hill Madeleine is elegant in a suit. Kathy looks at her black dress, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a specific way of addressing the High Commissioner of the Mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call him Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy nods, nervous. They pull into a circular drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is incongruous in its context: Manicured garden remodelled facade. And tonight its BLACK TIE and CATERING An elegant WOMAN comes to greet them. She is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (familiar) Mrs. Ambassador! How do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do what we can. Great to see you Madeleine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet smiles with the delicatesse of a diplomatic spouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't mind, I've brought along a friend. This is Kathy Bolkovac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy holds out her hand, a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I need as many gal pals as I can get. Look at this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures toward the room. A haze of cigar smoke hover over the gaggle of men. Kathy's eyes zero in on Bill Hynes Surrounded by a group of JAPANESE DIPLOMATS. Bill notices and Madeleine. He waves, familiar. Madeleine nods, humori AMBASSADOR JOHN WELLS, 40s, slides his hand on Janet's ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are your thoughts on dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think people are still busy drinking. John shakes Madeleine's hand, darting his eyes over Kathy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of, what can I get you ladies? Madeleine looks at Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Ambassador. Ah, I'll have a wine please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Coming right up. Madeleine, white for you? Kathy notices the respect he shows her. Janet leads them chatting with Madeleine. Kathy surveys the room full of dignitaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunning view of Sarajevo at night. Kathy stands alone. waiter offers her a convoluted hors d'oeuvre. She takes i gracious. Trying to figure out what it is when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice view, no? Kathy turns to... PETER WARD, 40s, smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I... I just needed some air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I know the feeling. I hate these stuffy events. You never know anyone's agenda. He eyes her. She looks past him... At Bill Hynes. Peter s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well that's a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I had a different one in mind. Madeleine and Janet come through the door. Peter stubs ou his cigarette, and moves back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arm around Janet) Behind every good man...

dialogues.speaker: PATIO
dialogues.text: Janet's eyes betray empathy. She shakes her head, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just left her there? At the border? Poor girl... Just the psychological trauma. How can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very vulnerable to re-trafficking. Internationals got her in this situation. We owe her the chance to get out. Janet is keen to follow, but a little lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to repatriate Irka to the United States and find her a foster family. I was hoping you could use your influence-- Janet holds up her hand, nodding emphatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find her a home. Kathy eyes Madeleine. Impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also think the American embassy should be aware of some of the problems we're having with our officers. Madeleine interjects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your help with Irka's case can really raise awareness in the Mission around the issue of trafficking. Madeleine gives her a reassuring glance. Kathy sees the difference between a cop and a diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands. Still in her dress, going through files. Pr of the night's accomplishments, but her eyes linger on th board of girls... On the picture of Raya's APB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun over the hills. A DOG follows a YOUNG BOY, 5, through field. The boy stops, seeing a BROWN VAN down the road. He runs, waving as the van approaches. It slows to meet h In the van... Ivan rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. The boy looks down, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your mother I'll be home for dinner. Then you and I will go for a walk. I have a present for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Ivan shrugs jokingly. Then smiles as he drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brown van pulls up. Ivan comes around it, and opens t back door. He reaches in and pulls out... AN OLD BICYCLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't buy him a new one? You have money now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fix this one up this afternoon. I had one like it. Tanjo lights a cigarette, moving to the destroyed buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're downstairs. I want to get them out today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan follows Tanjo down rickety steps. CRIES AND WHIMPERS GROW LOUDER as they descend into a

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: TWO MEN stand guard. Tanjo walks past them. Opens a door. Ushering Ivan INSIDE where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRLS are huddled together. Luba, and THREE OTHERS. They up... PETRIFIED... Offscreen, the cries swell. We realize the sound IS NOT COMING FROM THIS ROOM. Tanjo waves his fingers, methodically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go. The girls stand, helping one another. Tentative but submissive, they move toward him. He holds open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you what happens when YOU

dialogues.speaker: DECIDE TO TALK TO COPS
dialogues.text: They jump back. His scream echoes. They move

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE HALL
dialogues.text: To a door on the other side. Tanjo nods. A guard opens th door onto A HORRIFIC SITE... Luba closes her eyes. But Ta pushes the girls in, one by one they go through into a

dialogues.speaker: BARREN ROOM
dialogues.text: And see... Raya... NAKED. HELD DOWN BY FOUR MEN. SPREAD E ON HER FRONT. WAILING. HER FACE SHOWS UNIMAGINABLE PAIN. we see that... Two of the men holding her down are EXTINGUISHING LIT CIGARETTES INTO THE BALLS OF HER FOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!! But we realize... this is not the greatest cause of her p Luba's face whitens. Eyeing one MAN at Raya's backside. A flash of shame in his eyes as he steps away from Raya, an drops... A PIPE onto the ground. The men step away. Leaving Raya. Collapsed into a ball. N the girls all understand... there is no hope at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine stands before a small group of REPORTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young woman, who shall remain anonymous, arrived in Bosnia as a victim of sex trafficking and has survived horrific abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ordinarily she would be repatriated to her country of origin. But because she is an orphan, she finds herself without a home. I'm pleased to announce that we have found a foster family in the United States. I want to thank Janet Wells for her assistance in making this happen. I believe this can stand as a signal that the International community in Bosnia and beyond is finally ready to recognize the growing epidemic of sex trafficking, a human rights abuse as abhorrent as the war crimes that drew the International Community to intervene in Bosnia in the first place. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the UN is finally recognizing sex-trafficking, how are you going to monitor it? Reporters flock with questions. Kathy stands in the back, proud. On the other side, Rick Jones watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Madeleine emerge, buzzing with their success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing on Raya? Kathy shakes her head, saddened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've sent an APB out to all police stations and UN field offices... But I'm pushing ahead with the other girls in Milena's shelter. I'm creating a photo- line-up using the UN ID database, so they can identify all internationals involved. We've got to make them accountable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milena looks through a glass window into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits with girls including Fadila, Nadia, Eva... She brings up ID PHOTOS of IPTF officers, scrolling down the page. Fadila points at one and nods, speaking. Kathy writ Another girl, JASMILA, points at a picture of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN IPTF OFFICER. She nods. Kathy brings up a new page of ID PHOTOS. Flicking through page after page. The girls identify SEVERAL OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy finds Carmen behind a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a favour to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have access to all transport vehicle checkouts, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a fountain of useless knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see how often Fred Murray has checked out raid vehicles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Murray? Kathy nods. Carmen looks at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred was sent home. Kathy stands back. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why didn't anyone tell me. Is he being disciplined because of my-- Carmen shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just gone. Meaning investigation over. They wanted him out of here. People are talking. Come on, let's get some lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Carmen at a table in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kath, you gotta be careful. Look, I know you're doing your own thing and all, but you're investigating your colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. I just, the stuff people are saying, I'm catching snippets, and I'm worried about you. Think about your kids. Kathy is silenced. Then... A TAP ON HER SHOULDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for you in Human Resources. Carmen eyes Kathy, concerned. Kathy follows the monitor toward the exit. MONITORS and CIVILIANS buzz about, talki But all around Kathy, the air is silent. Some IPTF OFFICE eye her, coolly. Is she paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BLAKELY smiles formally. Kathy shifts in her seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm John Blakely, Human Resources. Kathy eyes him, dubious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In going through your records, I see you've got quite a case load. It must be stressful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) A bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you say you're under extreme stress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are concerns among some of your superiors that you've become impulsive, reckless in your position. Kathy sits, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to suggest taking some time off. You have some leave time... Kathy eyes him coolly. He slides over a booklet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See here? You can consolidate your leave. We'll contact our head offices in the U.K. and ensure none of your pay would be deducted... Just... Take a little vacation. Go home. See your kids. We're simply suggesting this out of concern for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting I take time off. Or are you telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is simply out of concern for you. Kathy pushes her chair back, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits at the table, covered in photos of girls, flip through the Dyncorp manual, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consolidate my leave... A fucking vacation? She shakes her head, overwrought. Flipping through the manual, seeing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these people? (stopping on a page) And why does Dyncorp, a company that sends American peacekeepers, have it's corporate headquarters in England? She looks up at Jan. He shrugs, sympathetic, wanting to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I want to see my kids, of course. But... not like this. Not by being sent home like some hysterical woman... My God, it wasn't that easy to up and leave them. If I go home like this... It's like coming here, this whole thing was a... mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, lost in thought... Maybe it was... J sits beside her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody who knows you could think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I'm losing witnesses, suspects... It's one step forward, two steps back... Jan tries to jump in. But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously. I'm just a cop from Nebraska. What do I know? Jan shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what. It's who. You know them. He points at the files and photos of girls splayed all ov the table. Kathy eyes them, torn between self-doubt and something much more instinctive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sits across from Halyna, who is heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kochan... It's been a few weeks now. I don't know if there's much point--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we-- I must-- I have to do something. There has to be something I can do?! Laura takes a second. Suddenly struck with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large WOOD HOUSE with a neon CAMEL sits in the mountain above the city of TUZLA. A VAN pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya, Luba follow Ivan up stairs. Ivan unlocks a

dialogues.speaker: BACK BEDROOM
dialogues.text: He bangs on a wall. FIVE GIRLS wake in cots on the ground motions for them to go in. They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARA, 19, hands Raya and Luba a piece of paper with CRUDE DRAWINGS of SEXUAL POSITIONS. A price value by each. MARA (RUSSIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work in two hours. Ivan and Mara leave, locking the door behind him. The other girls go about their business, barely noticing and Luba. But JULIA and TANYA, 16, come over. JULIA (RUSSIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleep on whichever mattresses are available. The last two girls in have to share. TANYA (RUSSIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bring us food in the morning. You have to eat it all, or you get fined. Raya grabs her head. Feeling faint. She looks for a place sit. Julia and Tanya help her to the ground. JULIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him see you like this. Luba walks over to the other side of the room. Finds a sp and sits. Raya watches her, hurt. Julia pushes a mattress aside. Underneath is a... COUNTING SYSTEM scratched into floor. Each girls' name scratched with numbers beside it. JULIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the closest. Then I can go home. Raya barely has the energy to hold herself up. TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? RAYA (UKRAINIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rayisa...Raya Kochan. Tanya scratches Raya's name into the floor. Then one mark LUBA (RUSSIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all bullshit-- JULIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He sent a girl back three months ago. I was here! (to Luba) What is your name? Raya eyes Luba who's conflicted between loyalty to her fr and her own sense of survival. Luba tears up, but turns a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Her name is Luba. Luba Pankiw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy works, angry, urgent now. On her desk... CLOSER: REPORT: PHOTO ID LINE-UP. Kathy matches circled I photos of IPTF alongside testimony and Polaroids of girls She works fast. Circling the photos, slapping files close When a... MAIL BOY slides in a cart, and places a stack of REPORTS Kathy's IN-BOX. She pulls the first one off the top... A sticky note on the first page: Insufficient Evidence. Kathy grabs another... Sticky note: Unreliable Witness. S sees the name NADIA at the top of the statement. She grabs... ANOTHER: Unreliable Witness. And another... Transferred to Internal Affairs. Kathy flies through the rest of the files. One after anot Insufficient Evidence -- Insufficient Evidence -- Transfe to Internal Affairs --Unreliable Witnesses -- Insufficien A photo falls out of one of them: RAYA. Kathy stares at i Her eyes wander over the room, and fall on her predecesso battered old file boxes, still waiting for Archives. She moves to them. Cuts the string on the top box. Rips t top off. Inside... REPORT FILES. Slotted in tight. She grabs one. STICKY NOT Insufficient Evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. She starts RIPPING through them all -- YELLOW STICKY NOTE all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kath... It's Jim Higgins, out of breath, in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've called an assembly for all Dyncorp personnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Jim walk into a room filled with DYNCORP BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone know what this is about? No one does. Kathy sits amongst the guys. Until... Rick walks up to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some not so pleasant news, but bear with me. (Off a prepared statement) Lately, local police have raided some houses of `ill repute' and a number of `ladies of the evening' have been taken into custody. While the credibility of these witnesses is questionable, apparently photo line-ups have been made available to them. Rick eyes Kathy, pointedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This issue is currently receiving a lot of attention. Guys, you gotta be careful... Kathryn Bolkovac is heading up this investigation. If you have any questions refer them to her. ALL EYES ON KATHY. They disperse, passing her, camaraderi obliterated. Kathy walks, livid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've given every officer time to create an alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to subject my men to this witch hunt based on the testimony of some hookers! Prostitution is illegal! Your witnesses are criminals. Kathy can't believe what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are SLAVES. By any American or International law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These slaves are lying about their presence in Bosnia. You are coming after American Officers with baseless claims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you know they're not baseless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've got a problem, go call the Ambassador's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN. Kathy comes out. Seeing... IPTF OFFICERS. All eyeing her. She hurries through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits, anxious. Jan touches her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hired you to do a job they don't want done. It's a P.R. position. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick publicly outed me, jeopardizing those girls. I have to go over his head. But I... I never thought I'd have to go into Internal Affairs. The guys back home would never understand this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? And how long do you plan on being around, because the last two guys who said that aren't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just I waited so long you know. I want my kids to know I did something, to be proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Your kids are proud. You go on this mission and you're a big hero. I go and I'm a bad mother... (tearing up) I can't believe I'm gonna disappoint them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't. He comes closer. She looks up. Decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of light through Kathy's windshield. The lot is empty. She looks at a PILE OF REPORTS on the passenger se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, reports in hand, turns a corner, and... bumps into OFFICER. She drops some files. He moves around her, as sh bends to pick them up. She walks the rest of the hall, focused, and stops at a brass plaque: INTERNAL AFFAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy marches in, nervous... MONITORS turn and see her, knowing who she is, but trying not to show it. She approa a MALE MONITOR at a desk in the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you? The Monitor keeps typing as she talks. Kathy hesitates, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, I need to speak in-camera with a senior IA official. I don't have a name, but-- Kathy recognizes Peter Ward working in a back OFFICE. He her, then closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits across from an IA OFFICIAL, 50s. He skims thro the reports, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a photo ID line-up with victims who testified to international patronizing of brothels, as well as complicity in trafficking itself. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cases I filed to my superiors have come back, shut down. Some of them were marked as referred to IA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? He shakes his head, standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible they're still in the pipeline, in preliminary processing. I'm sorry to have to rush this, but I have to get to a meeting. Thanks for coming in. He hands her a form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to sign here, that you're asking for these investigations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy jogs along a ridge, with a view high over Sarajevo. Determined, panting... she pushes past her fatigue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy comes in, soaked in sweat. The PHONE RINGS. She rus to it. CALLER ID: Unknown Number. She picks up, breathles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Sorry, who is this?... Just one second... She grabs a pen and pad. Writing: THE HOLIDAY INN. 513.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get your name? Hello? Hello? She looks at the phone, spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy moves through the lobby, scanning the scene of liqu lunches and diplomats. She keeps her head low, focused

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ELEVATORS
dialogues.text: Ding. The doors open. Kathy steps in. As they close... TW DIPLOMATS slip in. The elevator ascends. Kathy stares dea ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands at door 513. She takes a moment, then knocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy is led in by Peter Ward. She comes inside, tentativ unsure who she's dealing with. Peter smokes furiously, a burned-out mission lifer, who's bright, intelligent eyes betray a last spark of the idealism that brought him into this world. He seems nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was you today, in IA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Would you like a drink? Kathy eyes him, dubious. He pours her a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your files... Kathy nods. Peter slaps down a file. Kathy looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're investigating you. Kathy stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? They're circling the wagons... What did he tell you? He hadn't seen anything from you until today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. PETER WARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Top Level Dyncorp commanders are walking into IA and removing your files. I've been told to shut down all your investigations. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?.. There has to be some sort of an international court or body that can turn this around-- PETER WARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United Nations. You're here. Peter thinking about how to put this... PETER WARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyncorp's contract with the State Department in Bosnia alone is worth 52 million dollars. We're paid ninety, a hundred grand, right?. But it's a drop in the ocean compared to their profits. This is a global corporation, top five defense contractors in the states after Halliburton and KB&R. You think they're gonna let some sex scandal threaten that? KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a scandal. I just want-- PETER WARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOBODY CARES ABOUT YOU. It's designed that way. No oversight. No national or international accountability. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyncorp's Headquarters are in England-- PETER WARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Nothing leads back to the State Department. That includes you... So if something were to happen to you it wouldn't even make the news at home... No one would ever know... Poof. You're gone. Kathy sits. Scared. Finally understanding the world she's O.S. VOICES. Kathy jolts. Peter moves to the door. THROUGH THE EYE-HOLE: A COUPLE checks in across the room. Peter turns back. Sees a panic-stricken Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to keep going, you've got to stay under the radar. Make copies of all your files, keep them under lock and key. Just... Be careful... And know who you're up against.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy. Unstrung. She crosses the labyrinth of WHITE SUVs. looks up at the OSCE towers. Feeling watched. TWO SFOR SOLDIERS walk toward her. Eyeing her. She slips car key between her fingers, arming herself. Watching the as... They pass. Kathy picks up her pace. Getting to... HER SUV. Her pulse RACING. PARANOID. She checks around... The lot is empty. Quiet. She is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of international flags flap in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy watches the flags. She shifts her gaze to the bulle board. Eyeing the picture of Raya. Then... she moves to.. THE FILE CABINET. She pulls out   EVERY FILE. Photocopies Then... Opens the bottom filing   cabinet -- pushes files the front -- placing the copies   in the back. She steps away... Closes the Cabinet. And   locks it... Knowing she is operating outside of protocol now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya stares at herself in a mirror. Dressed as a whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more of a medium-sized hall. A bar, some tables and few `home touches'. Maps of Yugoslavia. Pictures of Tito. And FULL OF IPTF. Raya walks through, ogled. She sees... Luba, sitting on Mara's lap. Surrounded by TEN IRISH SOLDIERS. The soldiers ply them with drinks, `winning' th with charm. Luba blends in with remarkable ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel like a party? RORY, Irish, grabs Raya's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing) Yes... of course. He leads her to the back of the bar. Raya looks to Luba, realizes she is alone. They walk through a BACK DOOR into a ROOM FULL OF BEDS SEPARATED with CURTAINS. We barely make out the shapes of various soldiers with girls in each cubicle. All busy. Un A curtain opens... And Jim Higgins walks out. His rite of passage complete. Rory pulls Raya to the cubicle, as Julia comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halyna boards a plane with PASSENGERS, but without Raya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy opens the door into the empty apartment, seeing a RAPIDLY BLINKING LIGHT on a digital display: 14 MESSAGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. Click. Click. Each message a silence followed by a hang-up. Kathy stare the blinking light as the clicks keep coming. CLICK, CLIC CLICK... She rips the machine out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a DIAL UP CONNECTION. Kathy's at her computer. Sh brings up a Yahoo! Search page. TYPES IN: RICK JONES 2103 Matches for Rick Jones. She types again. CLOSE ON: RICK JONES + COLORADO SPRINGS 482 Matches for Rick Jones + Colorado Springs She scans down the page. None of the matches work. She sh her head, about to give up, when... Chief of Police R. Jones in $1,000,000 Law Suit A PICTURE of Rick Jones accompanies the article. CLOSE ON WORDS: Richard Jones Fired for Sexual Harassment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits at the empty kitchen table looking at the pict of her kids. She holds her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant music echoes through the night. VOICES of GUYS hanging out on their balconies. Kathy crosses the lot, cutting through the dark night fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy drives. Wide awake. The only vehicle on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits in the SUV. Staring at the station. THROUGH TH WINDOW... Jan works the late shift alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jan and Kathy sit. Several empty coffee cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is... I can't believe your timing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rotation. They're sending us back a month early. I tried to get an extension, but... Kathy just stares ahead. Silent... a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even sure I'm staying. Jan sits back. Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys... Jones is a sexual offender. Dyncorp hired him... These private militaries are a sham. There's no way around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's what your instincts are telling you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have children, I have to think about them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big IPTF PARTY. AT THE BAR: Raya waits with an empty tr Luba pulls out a heavy crate of bottles. She hurts her ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I'll help you. Luba slams two bottles on Raya's tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I earned this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. You'll get us in trouble. An IPTF OFFICER, MIKE SEARS grabs Raya from behind. Shake her, jokingly. She laughs, familiar. Almost routine..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my favorite girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am good. Everything good. She smiles, hollow and takes the tray over to a TABLE. Ju and Tanya sit with FOUR MEN in suits. They're plastered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna party all night. The girls smile, nodding, playing along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go out. I wanna take you home. He squeezes Tanya tight to him, kissing her sloppily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan! C'mere! Raya eyes Julia. Ivan comes over, smiling, a gregarious h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanna party on mate. How much to take them home for the day? Ivan eyes the girls. Thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten times normal. Pay upfront. And extra deposit. But you cannot take her. He points at Raya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three thousand each. (off their scoffing) You bring back, you get back deposit. Ivan smiles. The other two men are dubious. But Suit 1 an Suit 2 exchange glances... Daring each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on. Ivan waves to follow him. They walk with Julia and Tanya. Raya watches Ivan throw in a bottle of whiskey. They pay Julia catches Raya's eye. They exchange... A look of prom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUTCH CONTINGENT boards a bus. Kathy stands aside wit Jan. Saying goodbye... Franz pats Jan on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep an eye out. Jan shakes his hand. Franz winks at Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kathy) It's finally our time. She smiles, soft. Drained of energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you need you call, okay? He'll kill both of us if you don't. Franz moves away leaving the two alone. Jan hugs Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to me... when you're done. He kisses her. The bus engines start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy watches out the window. DIPLOMATS walk the halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this I hear about you leaving? Kathy turns to Madeleine in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dutch Officer rang before he left. C'mon, I want to show you something. Kathy follows, downbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls clean. Raya sweeps, watching Mara teach Luba ho restock the bar. Ivan comes out of the OFFICE. A bag in h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madeleine's UN Volkswagon pulls up. Milena waits, smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we got Irka repatriated, I had some calls from other private parties that were interested in helping. We've gathered $40,000 so far. I've applied for matching funds, so that... we can completely rebuild this shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Separate from the GDA. We run it our way. The victims come first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are changing Kathy. Kathy is moved, seeing a light at the end of this. The th women stand, united... Then... A SHELTER VOLUNTEER comes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an important call inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The call is for Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan puts a bag in a car trunk. He turns to... Mara

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I can bring you back here the second you fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mara nods. He shakes her hand. Ivan hands her a passport. jumps into the car. It's an odd farewell. Ivan heads back

dialogues.speaker: THE OASIS
dialogues.text: He scans the room. His eyes land on Luba. Raya watches Iv nod to Luba. A silent exchange: Luba accepts Mara's role. SUDDENLY... HONKING. OUTSIDE a car speeds up. The two SUITS from last night appear at the door... Witho the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy slows... Seeing local police in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy pulls up. Through gathered local cops, REVEAL... Julia and Tanya. Disoriented. Still in last night's cloth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia and Tanya are FRANTIC, talking fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take us home. They were so drunk. We run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are more girls! You must to get them out! Go now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appeal to Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oasis Bar. In mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy eyes Viko. As the girls talk at her, Kathy knows sh was never going home. THIS is where she needs to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy brings Julia and Tanya in. An Intern leads them dow the hall. Viko comes in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I call for a raid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He'll walk. We have no proof they were trafficked. Let me talk to them. See what else they know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura watches video footage on a TV. Halyna appears on th monitor. Her assistant PAUSES it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their first cut. I'll pass on your notes, and they should have it ready for the grant proposal in time. A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands, curt now with Laura. All business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no options right now. The GDA is more secure than Milena's shelter... Can they stay before you do the paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll go on record? Kathy nods. Laura shrugs in assent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy listens to a tearful Julia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan is good friends with the soldiers. They come all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're saying these soldiers brought you into Bosnia. Through the border? You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In a van. White van. Like yours. They both nod. Emphatic. Kathy thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had uniforms? Like mine? The girls nod again. Absolutely sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April 8. I never forget. The day I leave my home. We come to Bosnia some day later. I know because we stop at the border. We were six of us. Men from the border, they opened the doors... We give them our fake passports. My name was Irena Woycek. I thought they would see the fake passports, I thought... She hesitates, the memories flooding back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they would save us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko follows Kathy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there are records showing those girls came through the border with IPTF--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have conspiracy to traffick. And I can take it to Bill Hynes. That's enough to do a raid that will stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main border station keeps the logs. Kathy heads to her SUV. Viko shakes his head -- points at old TRABBANT (a life-size matchbox car).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ride is bumpy. Viko shouts over the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best if it looks like a local matter. Get more info. You be my UN monitor, okay? Kathy smiles, cramped, but appreciative of his help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko talks to a BORDER COP sitting at an ancient Mac Computer. Kathy notices a calendar of Pamela Anderson frolicking in foamy surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when a vehicle is stopped, you'll keep all this on file here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! It's our fucking job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And other stations up the border send all their files to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some do, some don't. Fifty-fifty chance. Disappointing. Viko lights a smoke, offers one to the cop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say 30 minutes outside Sarajevo? Maybe Visegrad? You might be lucky. Lanky guy in their archives loves to send files. Kathy looks hopefully at Viko, who shrugs. Clicking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, 11th... (mumbling) ... No, no. You like?.. Big exciting to watch Bosnian police do boring things? Kathy smiles. He turns back, clicking. Then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me! UN vehicle with 6 girls in back. Stanley Harris. He turns proudly to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you think? All his little sisters come to visit from America? Viko looks knowingly at Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Conspiracy to traffick. He slaps a key. The file prints out on an old daisy-wheel printer. Kathy scans the pages...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy and Viko hurry to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We arrest the buyer first. The bar-owner. The border log corroborates the victims' testimony. Once he's in custody, we raid his place and get those girls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy jumps INSIDE THE CAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raid has to be small. No-one knows the bar till we're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy waits, nervous, holding the border logs. The RECEPTIONIST eyes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouldn't be long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill on the edge of his desk. Kathy paces, frantic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I came straight to you. They were brought across the border by our guys. I need two back-up security vans for a raid, with well-trained--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our resources are tight. I have to prioritize--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the border logs) This is real evidence. And that's just a drop in the ocean. I have hundreds of files. Photos, corroborated statements. We can build this case and get the perpetrators out of the mission-- Bill shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could give you a piece of advice it would be to think of the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These girls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are Collateral Damage. Whores of War. It's nothing new. Every conflict produces them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know as well as I do, those girls aren't a product of the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a product of the peace. For the peace-keepers. Kathy is repulsed. Bill takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your first mission. You're eager. But we work in a very grey area and that can get messy. Everybody wants the UN to take the gloves off but they don't want us to get our hands dirty. It's a fucking Catch-22. So what do we do? We prioritize. We do our best and we always look at the bigger picture. You're a mother. Fine. I see what you're doing with these girls. Maybe that's why you're thinking with your heart not your head. But you have a chance at a career in the international sector. Ride this out. Get a promotion. Human Rights in Liberia, Afghanistan... I don't give a shit. And then, when you're running the show, you can implement whatever changes you see fit. But right now be smart and shut this bullshit down! The veil is lifted. Kathy stands frozen. The blunt workin of the machine are laid bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy leans on a balcony overlooking the main plaza at HQ She observes the sleek facade of honor and power. She straightens, and walks away without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RAID TEAM suits up: FIVE LOCAL COPS and THREE IPTF OFFICERS. Viko turns and hands Kathy a helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Viko and other cops) Try and get him outside first, then arrest him. Once you've got him outta there we'll go in. I want the girls to know they're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police vans SPEEDS down the road. TWO UN VANS follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy focuses in the cabin filled with SUITED IPTF OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viko pulls up to the bar. The UN SUV skids into the shado Viko and Danik go inside. Kathy glances back at her IPTF officers as they -- Pull their visors down, and WAIT -- Q -- Wind in the trees -- MUSIC ECHOING from inside as... Viko and Danik emerge, chatting with Ivan. Suddenly... Ivan jolts back -- COPS grab him -- He's YELLING -- HANDCUFFED -- Kicking. Punching -- They PUSH him into the -- Viko SLAMS the door, turns to the UN van and nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy looks back to the IPTF officers, raises three fingers... then TWO...ONE... The POLICE VAN SQUEALS AWAY, as... They SLAM open the doors of the bar and RUSH INTO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURSTING in the doors -- Clients scatter -- RUSH to the E Girls turn from the bar, the stage, the seating area -- disoriented -- eyes darting... Local police spread around the bar, slamming, pushing cli outside. Kathy pulls off her helmet and SCANS the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a warrant to search this premises. The owner of this bar Ivan Bladzic has been arrested and taken into custody for human trafficking. The girls look at one another. Is this for real? The BARM steps forward... He looks like he's had a few drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Kathy eyes the girls. Their confusion, their fear... Danik, hesitates, confronted with the vulnerability of th girls... His face softens. He looks to Kathy for directio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not have to be afraid of Ivan Bladzic. He cannot hurt you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the GIRLS don't move... Kathy looks out -- Stunned -- Because she sees... Raya. Standing. Shocked. No idea who to trust anymore. On last shred left of the dream of escape... Kathy goes to her. But Raya's eyes dart to... Luba. Then to Kathy, recognizing the last kind face she saw... BARMAN (BROKEN ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These girls work here. They have all documents, passports! You can fuck off. Two local cops GRAB him. Danik CUFFS him. The girls are astounded. Viko holds up passports. VIKO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fakes. Bad ones. The barman is dragged outside. Kathy scans the girls. End on Raya... her faith awakening. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to get you out of here safely. That is my absolute priority. The girls exchange a flurry of looks, speaking volumes... Should we trust her? Can we risk it? KATHY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Viko) Get those blankets out of the vans. Let's get these girls out. But the girls still don't move... Raya. Fractured with despair... After all she has been through, all the punishment, all the pain... Raya holds Luba's gaze - Maybe even she could be convince And Raya starts to step to Kathy... When... Behind Kathy, an IPTF officer removes his helmet. Mike Se He stares at Raya. Petrifying her. Kathy sees it in her -- WHIPS around. Mike Sears avoids h gaze. Kathy turns back to Raya. Moving closer, quietly, o of earshot of the others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just have to tell me you want to go. That you do not work here voluntarily. And we will get you to safety. Raya wants so badly to answer. KATHY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can leave with me this second. All of you can. But I need you to say it. Raya eyes Mike Sears - He looks to Luba. Luba turns back Raya - Pleading -- Don't do it. KATHY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know me. Raya can't look at Kathy. Tears stream down her face. KATHY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can all leave with me! (to Raya) Let's go. Raya. With her heart breaking... RAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Kathy looks at the all girls. Their eyes flitting between Mike and Kathy... And she understands... Kathy REELS around. Grabs Mike by the collar -- SHOVING h to the door -- SLAMMING him against the wall. KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? What have you done? What's wrong with you? What's wrong with you? You fuck! Mike pushes back... MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me, you crazy bitch! KATHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We may be accused of thinking with our hearts instead of our heads, but we will have our integrity. We pull back as she sits in front of the computer. Nothin but the screen illuminating her face...

dialogues.text: Karen squeezes Kathy's hand. Kathy looks to the back of t courtroom... Erin smiles at Kathy. So proud. JUDGE SWISS holds up Kathy's TAPE RECORDER... Kathy straightens. The Judge reads from a VERDICT. Karen' face lights up. Kathy's won. Jan breathes, relieved.

dialogues.text: Mara and Luba sit across from a YOUNG GIRL, 16. The girl excitedly flips through a SWISS HOTEL BROCHURE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You both worked here? Mara looks at Luba, a 'do or die' look in her eye. Hiding shame, she gathers her strength for this lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It will change your life.

dialogues.speaker: AND IN THE COURTROOM
dialogues.text: FLASHBULBS pop as Kathy stands... Pleased, but not elated The Dyncorp team files out. As the judges stand, one of t eyes Kathy. And they connect. As only true lawmen do. But in this moment, the Judge, Kathy and us... We all kno She never wanted to win. She just wanted to do her job.

dialogues.text: The sixty-story high STATUE of MOTHER UKRAINE guards Kyiv

dialogues.text: A PRIEST delivers a sermon. His eyes on Halyna. She sits, holding a picture of Raya. A sprinkling of MOURNERS near

dialogues.text: The member countries' flags crack in the wind. WHITE UN VEHICLES are parked outside. The United Nations stands wa FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We end this film with FOOTAGE of THE REAL KATHRYN BOLKOVA her BBC HARDTALK INTERVIEW with TIM SEBASTIAN. Show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked to Bill Hynes, who was the senior UN official in Bosnia at the time, we talked to him a year ago, on this program about some of your allegations. He said they weren't true at all. He said 'We've had senior officials from New York, we've had investigations from the State Department... I can now categorically say that not a single UN official was involved in trafficking'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that Mr. Hynes knows this is a false statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're accusing him of lying. That not a single word he said is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched that... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim shifts. Kathy sits calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I would. No doubt about it... I would definitely do it again. I'm not the type of person who would... As a law enforcement officer, I am held to a higher standard.
